segment.source: What's new in User Account Control (Windows 10)
segment.target: What's new in User Account Control (Windows 10)

segment.source: User Account Control (UAC) helps prevent malware from damaging a computer and helps organizations deploy a better-managed desktop environment.
segment.target: User Account Control (UAC) helps prevent malware from damaging a computer and helps organizations deploy a better-managed desktop environment.

segment.source: What's new in User Account Control?
segment.target: What's new in User Account Control?

segment.source: User Account Control (UAC) helps prevent malware from damaging a computer and helps organizations deploy a better-managed desktop environment.
segment.target: User Account Control (UAC) helps prevent malware from damaging a computer and helps organizations deploy a better-managed desktop environment.

segment.source: You should not turn off UAC because this is not a supported scenario for devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: You should not turn off UAC because this is not a supported scenario for devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: If you do turn off UAC, all Univeral Windows Platform apps stop working.
segment.target: If you do turn off UAC, all Univeral Windows Platform apps stop working.

segment.source: You must always set the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionPoliciesSystemEnableLUA registry value to 1.
segment.target: You must always set the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionPoliciesSystemEnableLUA registry value to 1.

segment.source: If you need to provide auto elevation for programmatic access or installation, you could set the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionPoliciesSystemConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin registry value to 0, which is the same as setting the UAC slider Never Notify.
segment.target: If you need to provide auto elevation for programmatic access or installation, you could set the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionPoliciesSystemConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin registry value to 0, which is the same as setting the UAC slider Never Notify.

segment.source: This is not recommended for devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: This is not recommended for devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: For more info about how manage UAC, see UAC Group Policy Settings and Registry Key Settings.
segment.target: For more info about how manage UAC, see UAC Group Policy Settings and Registry Key Settings.

segment.source: In Windows 10, User Account Control has added some improvements.
segment.target: In Windows 10, User Account Control has added some improvements.

segment.source: Integration with the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI).
segment.target: Integration with the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI).

segment.source: The AMSI scans all UAC elevation requests for malware.
segment.target: The AMSI scans all UAC elevation requests for malware.

segment.source: If malware is detected, the admin privilege is blocked.
segment.target: If malware is detected, the admin privilege is blocked.

segment.source: Learn how to manage User Account Control within your organization.
segment.target: Learn how to manage User Account Control within your organization.
